value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices. value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. value.title: Wednesday with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new Power BI DAX Series. Every Wednesday, we will talk about different DAX functions.

topItems.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Welcome to my new series – “Wednesday with DAX”. This is the first video of this series. The first episode covers all Date and Time functions used in Power BI In this video, we will talk about Date and Time functions in Power BI. We will discuss about most useful date and time functions in Power BI.

topItems.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
topItems.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you’re seeking for deeper analytics.

topItems.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX

How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

topItems.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX

topItems.title: Measures vs. calculated columns in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Working with Time Periods in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do you work with time periods in Power BI like last month? Patrick digs in to show how you can accomplish this with a little DAX.  Fourmoo Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2016/09/07/create-dynamic-periods-for-fiscal-or-calendar-dates-in-power-bi/  Phil Seamark Blog: https://dax.tips/2019/10/09/row-based-time-intelligence/

value.title: FREE Power BI Download, Install & Get Started in Minutes
value.excerpt: I will show you the two ways you can get the Power BI Download, Install it and Get Started in just a few minutes.I will also show you how Power BI Desktop, the tool you would be downloading, fits into the bigger Power BI and the Microsoft BI picture.  ➔ Links mentioned in the Video • Microsoft Download
